trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Operations.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Operations.

trans-unit.source: This article describes additional operations that can be performed once you have deployed Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: This article describes additional operations that can be performed once you have deployed Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Operations
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Operations

trans-unit.source: The following topic describes the various operations that can be performed using Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: The following topic describes the various operations that can be performed using Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Enable Email Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable Email Notifications

trans-unit.source: You can configure the Azure AD Connect Health Service to send email notifications when alerts are generated indicating your identity infrastructure is not healthy.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the Azure AD Connect Health Service to send email notifications when alerts are generated indicating your identity infrastructure is not healthy.

trans-unit.source: This will occur when an alert is generated, as well as when it is marked as resolved.
trans-unit.target: This will occur when an alert is generated, as well as when it is marked as resolved.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to configure email notifications.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to configure email notifications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Email notifications are disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Email notifications are disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: To enable Azure AD Connect Health Email Notifications
trans-unit.target: To enable Azure AD Connect Health Email Notifications

trans-unit.source: Open the Alerts Blade for the service for which you wish to receive email notification.
trans-unit.target: Open the Alerts Blade for the service for which you wish to receive email notification.

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Notification Settings" button from the action bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Notification Settings" button from the action bar.

trans-unit.source: Turn the Email Notification switch to ON.
trans-unit.target: Turn the Email Notification switch to ON.

trans-unit.source: Select the check box to configure all the Global Admins to receive email notifications.
trans-unit.target: Select the check box to configure all the Global Admins to receive email notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to receive email notifications on any other email addresses, you can specify them in the Additional Email Recipient box.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to receive email notifications on any other email addresses, you can specify them in the Additional Email Recipient box.

trans-unit.source: To remove an email address from this list, right click on the entry and select Delete.
trans-unit.target: To remove an email address from this list, right click on the entry and select Delete.

trans-unit.source: To finalize the changes click on "Save".
trans-unit.target: To finalize the changes click on "Save".

trans-unit.source: All changes will take effects only after you select "Save".
trans-unit.target: All changes will take effects only after you select "Save".

trans-unit.source: Delete a server or service instance
trans-unit.target: Delete a server or service instance

trans-unit.source: Delete a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service
trans-unit.target: Delete a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service

trans-unit.source: In some instances, you may wish to remove a server from being monitored.
trans-unit.target: In some instances, you may wish to remove a server from being monitored.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to remove a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to remove a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service.

trans-unit.source: When deleting a server, be aware of the following:
trans-unit.target: When deleting a server, be aware of the following:

trans-unit.source: This action will STOP collecting any further data from that server.
trans-unit.target: This action will STOP collecting any further data from that server.

trans-unit.source: This server will be removed from the monitoring service.
trans-unit.target: This server will be removed from the monitoring service.

trans-unit.source: After this action, you will not be able to view new alerts, monitoring or usage analytics data for this server.
trans-unit.target: After this action, you will not be able to view new alerts, monitoring or usage analytics data for this server.

trans-unit.source: This action will NOT uninstall or remove the Health Agent from your server.
trans-unit.target: This action will NOT uninstall or remove the Health Agent from your server.

trans-unit.source: If you have not uninstalled the Health Agent before performing this step, you may see error events on the server related to the Health Agent.
trans-unit.target: If you have not uninstalled the Health Agent before performing this step, you may see error events on the server related to the Health Agent.

trans-unit.source: This action will NOT delete the data already collected from this server.
trans-unit.target: This action will NOT delete the data already collected from this server.

trans-unit.source: That data will be deleted as per the Microsoft Azure Data Retention Policy.
trans-unit.target: That data will be deleted as per the Microsoft Azure Data Retention Policy.

trans-unit.source: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the same server again, you will need to uninstall and re-install the health agent on this server.
trans-unit.target: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the same server again, you will need to uninstall and re-install the health agent on this server.

trans-unit.source: To delete a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service
trans-unit.target: To delete a server from Azure AD Connect Health Service

trans-unit.source: Open the Server Blade from the Server List Blade by selecting the server name to be removed.
trans-unit.target: Open the Server Blade from the Server List Blade by selecting the server name to be removed.

trans-unit.source: On the Server Blade, click on the "Delete" button from the action bar.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Blade, click on the "Delete" button from the action bar.

trans-unit.source: Confirm the action to delete the server by typing the server name in the confirmation box.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the action to delete the server by typing the server name in the confirmation box.

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Delete" button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Delete" button.

trans-unit.source: Delete a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service
trans-unit.target: Delete a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service

trans-unit.source: In some instances, you may wish to remove a service instance.
trans-unit.target: In some instances, you may wish to remove a service instance.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to remove a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to remove a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service.

trans-unit.source: When deleting a service instance, be aware of the following:
trans-unit.target: When deleting a service instance, be aware of the following:

trans-unit.source: This action will remove the current service instance from the monitoring service.
trans-unit.target: This action will remove the current service instance from the monitoring service.

trans-unit.source: This action will NOT uninstall or remove the Health Agent from any of the servers that were monitored as part of this service instance.
trans-unit.target: This action will NOT uninstall or remove the Health Agent from any of the servers that were monitored as part of this service instance.

trans-unit.source: If you have not uninstalled the Health Agent before performing this step, you may see error events on the server(s) related to the Health Agent.
trans-unit.target: If you have not uninstalled the Health Agent before performing this step, you may see error events on the server(s) related to the Health Agent.

trans-unit.source: All data from this service instance will be deleted as per the Microsoft Azure Data Retention Policy.
trans-unit.target: All data from this service instance will be deleted as per the Microsoft Azure Data Retention Policy.

trans-unit.source: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the service, please uninstall and re-install the health agent on all the servers that will be monitored.
trans-unit.target: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the service, please uninstall and re-install the health agent on all the servers that will be monitored.

trans-unit.source: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the same server again, you will need to uninstall and re-install the health agent on this server.
trans-unit.target: After performing this action, if you wish to start monitoring the same server again, you will need to uninstall and re-install the health agent on this server.

trans-unit.source: To delete a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service
trans-unit.target: To delete a service instance from Azure AD Connect Health Service

trans-unit.source: Open the Service Blade from the Service List Blade by selecting the service identifier (farm name) that you wish to remove.
trans-unit.target: Open the Service Blade from the Service List Blade by selecting the service identifier (farm name) that you wish to remove.

trans-unit.source: On the Server Blade, click on the "Delete" button from the action bar.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Blade, click on the "Delete" button from the action bar.

trans-unit.source: Confirm the service name by typing it in the confirmation box.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the service name by typing it in the confirmation box.

trans-unit.source: (for example: sts.contoso.com)
trans-unit.target: (for example: sts.contoso.com)

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Delete" button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Delete" button.

trans-unit.source: Manage Access With Role Based Access Control
trans-unit.target: Manage Access With Role Based Access Control

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: [Role Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md) for Azure AD Connect Health provides access Azure AD Connect Health service to users and/or groups outside of global administrators.
trans-unit.target: [Role Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md) for Azure AD Connect Health provides access Azure AD Connect Health service to users and/or groups outside of global administrators.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved by assigning roles to the intended users and\or groups and provides a mechanism to limit the global administrators within your directory.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved by assigning roles to the intended users and\or groups and provides a mechanism to limit the global administrators within your directory.

trans-unit.source: Roles
trans-unit.target: Roles

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health supports the following built-in roles.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health supports the following built-in roles.

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: Permissions
trans-unit.target: Permissions

trans-unit.source: Owner
trans-unit.target: Owner

trans-unit.source: Owners can ***manage access*** (e.g. assign role to a user/group), ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal and ***change settings*** (e.g. email notifications) within Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: Owners can ***manage access*** (e.g. assign role to a user/group), ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal and ***change settings*** (e.g. email notifications) within Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure AD global administrators are assigned this role and this cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure AD global administrators are assigned this role and this cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: Contributor
trans-unit.target: Contributor

trans-unit.source: Contributors can ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal and ***change settings*** (e.g. email notifications) within Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: Contributors can ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal and ***change settings*** (e.g. email notifications) within Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Reader
trans-unit.target: Reader

trans-unit.source: Readers can ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal within Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: Readers can ***view all information*** (e.g. view alerts) from the portal within Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: All other roles (such as ‘User Access Administrators’ or ‘DevTest Lab Users’), even if available in the portal experience, have no impact to access within Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: All other roles (such as ‘User Access Administrators’ or ‘DevTest Lab Users’), even if available in the portal experience, have no impact to access within Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Access Scope
trans-unit.target: Access Scope

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect supports managing access at two levels:
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect supports managing access at two levels:

trans-unit.source: ***All service instances***: This is the recommended path for most customers and controls access for all service instances (e.g. an ADFS farm) across all role types that are being monitored by Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: ***All service instances***: This is the recommended path for most customers and controls access for all service instances (e.g. an ADFS farm) across all role types that are being monitored by Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: ***Service Instance***: In some cases, you may need to segregate access based on role types or by a service instance.
trans-unit.target: ***Service Instance***: In some cases, you may need to segregate access based on role types or by a service instance.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you can manage access at the service instance level.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you can manage access at the service instance level.

trans-unit.source: Permission is granted if an end user has access either at the Directory or Service Instance level.
trans-unit.target: Permission is granted if an end user has access either at the Directory or Service Instance level.

trans-unit.source: How to allow users or groups access to Azure AD Connect Health
trans-unit.target: How to allow users or groups access to Azure AD Connect Health

trans-unit.source: Steps 1: Select the appropriate access scope
trans-unit.target: Steps 1: Select the appropriate access scope

trans-unit.source: To allow a user access at the *all service instances* level within Azure AD Connect Health, open the main blade in Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: To allow a user access at the *all service instances* level within Azure AD Connect Health, open the main blade in Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Add users, groups and assign roles
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Add users, groups and assign roles

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Users" part from the Configure section.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Users" part from the Configure section.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Main Blade
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Main Blade

trans-unit.source: Select "Add"
trans-unit.target: Select "Add"

trans-unit.source: Select the "Role" such as "Owner"
trans-unit.target: Select the "Role" such as "Owner"

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Add User
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Add User

trans-unit.source: Type the name or identifier of the targeted user or group.
trans-unit.target: Type the name or identifier of the targeted user or group.

trans-unit.source: You can select one or more users or groups at the same time.
trans-unit.target: You can select one or more users or groups at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Click "select".
trans-unit.target: Click "select".

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Select User
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Select User

trans-unit.source: Select "Ok".
trans-unit.target: Select "Ok".

trans-unit.source: Once the role assignment is complete, the users and/or groups will appear in the list.
trans-unit.target: Once the role assignment is complete, the users and/or groups will appear in the list.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC User List
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC User List

trans-unit.source: These steps will allow the listed users and group access as per their assigned roles.
trans-unit.target: These steps will allow the listed users and group access as per their assigned roles.

trans-unit.source: Global Administrators always have full access to all the operations but global administrator accounts will not be present in the above list.
trans-unit.target: Global Administrators always have full access to all the operations but global administrator accounts will not be present in the above list.

trans-unit.source: "Invite Users" feature is NOT supported within Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: "Invite Users" feature is NOT supported within Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Share the blade location with users or groups
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Share the blade location with users or groups

trans-unit.source: After assigning permissions, a user can access Azure AD Connect Health by going to [http://aka.ms/aadconnecthealth](http://aka.ms/aadconnecthealth).
trans-unit.target: After assigning permissions, a user can access Azure AD Connect Health by going to [http://aka.ms/aadconnecthealth](http://aka.ms/aadconnecthealth).

trans-unit.source: Once on the blade, the user can pin the blade or different parts to the dashboard by simply clicking "Pin to dashboard"
trans-unit.target: Once on the blade, the user can pin the blade or different parts to the dashboard by simply clicking "Pin to dashboard"

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC pin blade
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC pin blade

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A user with the "Reader" role assigned will not be able to perform the "create" operation to get Azure AD Connect Health extension from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A user with the "Reader" role assigned will not be able to perform the "create" operation to get Azure AD Connect Health extension from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: This user can still get to the blade by going to the above link.
trans-unit.target: This user can still get to the blade by going to the above link.

trans-unit.source: For subsequent usage, the user can pin the blade to the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: For subsequent usage, the user can pin the blade to the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Remove users and/or groups
trans-unit.target: Remove users and/or groups

trans-unit.source: You can remove a user or a group added to Azure AD Connect Health Role Based Access Control part by right clicking and selecting remove.
trans-unit.target: You can remove a user or a group added to Azure AD Connect Health Role Based Access Control part by right clicking and selecting remove.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Remove User
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health RBAC Remove User
